file_content.text: Hah! We meet again! To share your company twice after so many years--I did not believe destiny could be so whimsical.
[Return a friendly nod]
I'm glad we'll be working together again, Doctor.
Hmmm... the intervening years have not treated you well.
[Ignore his criticism]
You spend five years in a toxic carbonite stasis and see how you feel.
A fair point, actually.
Well you're not looking so great yourself.
It is so true! I spent the last several years in a creative slump and, sadly lacking inspiration, let myself go. But these recent events have given me a renewed vigor and inspiration!
You know... I still look back fondly upon our collaboration on Makeb, toppling Toborro.
I don't remember working with you.
Mmm, severe memory loss? I had not known this to be a side effect of carbonite freezing....
[Stare blankly]
[Return a Glare]
I'm standing right here, you know....
Forgive me, I did not mean to belittle your disability.
Maybe you're just not as memorable as you think.
Possible... though highly unlikely....
At any rate, I am Doctor Juvard Illip Oggurobb, Artist of Technology! We collaborated years ago on Makeb to topple Toborro, the Mad Mogul.
I had hoped to be able to work together again, and now we have been given the opportunity. Let us not squander it with idle chatter. On to business!
Ah, excellent! I've been looking forward to our collaboration.
[Wait for Oggurobb to continue]
Mmm... Interesting....
Not entirely without potential... though I can't help but to have at least some reservations....
Lana, for her part, insists that you possess the skills necessary, and as she has given me no cause to doubt her judgment, I shall take her at her word.
[Remain quiet]
Who are you to judge me?
Remind me who you are, again?
Forgotten already? How disappointing... and rude.
I am Doctor Juvard Illip Oggurobb, Artist of Technology.
Pleased to meet you.
And I you! To have escaped the clutches of the Eternal Empire--from the clutches of Arcann himself! An inspirationally bold story.
We will be in sore need of such boldness if we are to be successful in our efforts here.
You speak Basic?
Ah yes, how could I forget... While you will seldom hear it, in truth all Hutts can speak basic... we simply choose not to do so.

Given the... diverse nature of those gathered here, and the... tenuous nature of some of the friendships, I find it prudent to minimize the risk of linguistic misunderstandings. Now then: onto more pressing concerns!
It is no secret that against the Eternal Empire we stand at a massive technological disadvantage. In fact, that is almost an understatement.
My role here is to coordinate the alliance effort to understand the Eternal Empire technology, and to develop our own to bring us to an even footing.
[Let him continue]
Even footing? That's quite a tall order.
I'm surprised you're helping us. I thought Hutts maintained neutrality.
Your casual bigotry aside, I'm afraid my brethren are being profoundly shortsighted in this matter. There is no neutrality with respect to the Eternal Empire, only eventual subjugation.
But I, for one, have had enough of delusional moguls in my lifetime! Let them sit in their sad denial, ensconced within their opulent palaces! Let them hasten their own demise with inaction!
It falls to those of us with vision to accomplish what they will not!
Consider me inspired.
I apologize for misjudging you.
We were talking about standing against the Eternal Empire's technology?
I'm not here to listen to you whine.
Forgive me for losing my temper. This is a matter of some frustration for me. Let us return to the matter at hand.

The task is daunting indeed... which is what makes it exciting! To succeed, we must gather scientists, researchers, and representatives from the galaxy's many sentient species for their fresh perspectives.
[He's on a roll, why interrupt him now?]
You said you already had someone in mind?
I do! An exceptional Gand--both a Findsman and an engineer by trade--is currently located in Zakuul's Old World district.
As I understand it, this individual--Yuun--is one of your former squadmates. I imagine you'll have little difficulty in convincing him to join us.
Findsmen have a unique perception of reality--they can intuit what others struggle to grasp at all.
This conversation has left me feeling inspired, and I must create.
Without even saying a word, you have managed to leave me inspired... truly impressive. I must create.
Ah, Commander! There you are. Well done! Yuun arrived a while ago, and I must confess I am already impressed.
Immediately upon his arrival he told me he could "feel that I was seeking." After a brief meditation, he located a precision torque-spanner that I had lost months ago!
And then, as if it were no more challenging of a thing, he pointed out the solution to a thruster heat dissipation problem that I've been staring at for the past week!
How did he put it? I believe he said something about "watching the river of heat, looking to where it met the sea".... Simply marvelous.
Glad to hear that Yuun is everything you'd hoped.
Continue to recruit for us individuals of such bold talent and insight, Commander--I suspect we will see tangible results rather soon indeed!
You let me know when you've found candidates, and I'll do what it takes to recruit them.
I do not have any recruitment leads at this time, but I will send you an alert if I learn anything.
In the meanwhile... this reflection has excited me all over again. My mind floods with inspired designs... I must create.
Commander! I recently had the pleasure of making introductions with Doctor Eckard Lokin. Another worthwhile find--well done as usual.
A brilliant geneticist, boldly riding the bleeding edges of both biomedical and genetics research. And such a warm and pleasant personality! Truly a treat to work with.
But Aygo is insisting upon confining the good doctor to military duties! I need your help in swatting his grubby little paws away!
I can understand Aygo's logic, given Lokin's extensive history with Imperial Intelligence, but from the moment I saw Eckard it was painfully obvious that art was his true calling.
Given Aygo's upbringing, I would frankly have thought him better able to understand this sort of thing.
You're right, Lokin has a place here. I'll tell Aygo to split his time between military and research duties.
Yes! I knew you understood these things! It is why we get along so well.
I'm sorry, but Aygo is right. Lokin's experience and insight are invaluable for our military operations. They need him full time.
Bah, not you too, Commander? Fine....
This day just goes from bad to worse. My new personal shielding prototype seems to have developed a bad habit of violently overloading.
While the explosions are both vibrant and dramatic, our soldiers express a strong preference for creating art, rather than becoming it.
The life of a genius is never easy....
Very well then, I'll get back to work. I was just consulting with Lokin about the tolerance for genetic mutation in sentients.
You see, a prototype cloaking generator we've been developing has a side effect of inducing genetic mutation. I was about to abandon it entirely...
But Lokin's work has shown that most sentients have a surprisingly high tolerance for alteration before truly harmful mutations manifest.
Commander! I wanted to share my gratitude over your recent recruitment of Talos Drellik, and commend your insight.
In truth, we have sorely needed an individual more specialized in ancient knowledge and the more Force-oriented technologies.
Sadly, my genius lies elsewhere, and as these types of technologies form the foundation of so much within the Eternal Empire, it has been a consistent stumbling block for us.
However Doctor Drellik's insights have already started to break down these barriers to our progress, and I delight to imagine the inevitable breakthroughs that will soon follow.
[Continue listening]
In fact, he was just speaking to me about the thesis for his doctorate, an in-depth analysis of an ancient race known as the Dashade. Fascinating work!
Apparently these creatures could siphon and consume Force essence! Imagine what might result if the mechanisms behind this ability could be properly researched and understood!

Could we create some sort of fixed, or even portable biotechnological platform? Some sort of Force-dampening or consuming field? Or... perhaps an explosive or warhead-like delivery platform? The possibilities... so myriad it is dizzying....
I... I must be alone with my thoughts. Such inspiration must be captured.
Commander! This latest discovery of yours--the Dashade--you have outdone yourself.
Talos was outright dumbfounded--he believed that the clues he found were most likely idle legend.
But this Dashade... a creature that can consume Force essence? This is groundbreaking.
I wish greatly to better understand this process, but, for his part, the Dashade is being uncooperative.
He will occasionally tolerate some cursory examination, but attempts at more in-depth analysis result in violent threats of surprising detail and specificity.
Relatedly, he has a stunningly detailed grasp of Hutt anatomy....
But I will not be deterred! The potential advances of understanding are too great to give up! Think of the possibilities!
Perhaps we could bribe him with a treat of sorts. Do you suppose you could convince Sana-Rae to part with one of her trainees? One of the less promising ones, of course.
That's horrible! How could you suggest that?
Well I realize it is not the most tasteful of options, but the Dashade is being unreasonable!
I don't think Sana-Rae could be convinced, no.
I unfortunately agree with your assessment. A pity... sometimes truly worthwhile art requires some sacrifice.
Pah, I shall think of some other solution....
I think she could be convinced. You should ask her.
Hmm... I had my doubts, but if you believe so, perhaps it is possible. No worthwhile art is made without some sacrifice... perhaps she actually understands this.
Very well, I shall try to find a good time to broach the subject. Thank you again, Commander.
Good idea! I'll try to convince her.
Excellent! Thank you, Commander. I shall await word.
Commander, I've been meaning to speak to you. This latest recruit, the Talz named Broonmark...

While Broonmark's penchant for rending and violent destruction is admittedly impressive--both for the primal intensity of his conviction, as well as the astounding efficiency and savagery of his expression...
And while life has consistently shown me that brilliance and inspiration can come from the most unexpected places...
[Say Nothing]
And while I believe that a broad diversity in knowledge, perspective, and biology, is a key strength of our effort...
[Say Nothing]
I cannot help but to have some measure of concern over the likelihood of this individual deciding on a whim to try and slaughter everyone within arm's reach.
[Interrupt Him] Oh spit it out already...
Broonmark is an unrepentant, xenophobic, psychopathic murderer, Commander. I question his value as an addition to our alliance.
Broonmark follows strength, and he's seen mine firsthand. He'll obey.
I'm the Alliance Commander. You don't get to question my decisions. He stays.
Do you want to be the one who tries to kick him out?
You jest, but this only underscores the problem.
Very well, I shall trust your judgment and give him a chance to demonstrate whatever brilliance you see in him.
Though you will understand if I keep him well away from the rest of our research team... and possibly under guard....
I suppose if nothing else, you never fail to add interest to my day, Commander. I should return to my art.
Greetings, Commander! May I help you?
How are things going here?
We are still just starting out, I'm afraid. While I am applying my talents as fully as circumstances allow, we lack both the people and resources for any work of satisfactory scale.
As things stand, it is hard to imagine we will be able to come to understand our adversary, or to develop effective counter-technology.
We're starting to see some limited progress, though I'm afraid I must stress the "limited." That said, the problem with a task of this size is always finding the appropriate inroads to begin.
While I believe we're just now... "clearing the hurdle" is how you pedal humanoids put it? We still have much and more work to do.
I am happy to report that progress seems to be picking up a bit. We're actually looking to start work on our first prototype built from the cooperative vision of the team.

It is an important milestone, but certainly not the last. As we look to build future advancements off of today's, it only becomes more important that we continue efforts to recruit and secure supplies.
You are a patron of our art, Commander. I am hopeful that you will be able to continue supporting us as we create yet more brilliant, bold, and groundbreaking artistry.
Commander, we have actually established a respectable foundation for a continuing research and development platform.
We currently have several running projects that are developing ideas into prototypes, and are finally seeing some results from our reverse engineering efforts.
This has taken no small amount of vision, boldness, genius, and perseverance... but I must also say that your continual support to this point has been quite instrumental.
But we cannot be happy with the successes of today! These new initiatives demand resources and minds all the same, and we still require whatever ongoing support you can offer.
What sorts of things can I do to help the effort here?
We are always in need of supplies--an artist cannot work without tools and material. If you could secure supplies for our research efforts, it would be most helpful.
I'd also ask you to keep a keen eye out for new research associates--having a new creator who can more efficiently use what is onhand is better than merely gathering more material!
I shall keep an eye out for potential recruits as well, and send you an alert whenever I find promising candidates.
I'll let you get back to work.
Very well, I shall return to creation.
I went through the trouble of finding you the help you wanted. Now I'm expecting some results.
Yeah, Yuun's... a little strange.
You're never satisfied, are you?
Pah. It is ever the burden of the brilliant to be considered strange by those who lack the vision or genius to understand the world as we do.
Did I not impress upon you earlier the enormity of our task? Success will require as much genius as we can manage to collect.
A Hutt scientist? That's new.
I can't believe they put a Hutt in charge here...
Come now, Commander. Such petty closed-mindedness is unbecoming. Especially given how crucial cooperation and collaboration will be if we are to succeed in our work here.
Bwaha!
[Turn in Alien Research] I have some things that might interest you....
Excellent, Commander. The support is appreciated.
[Back]
[Turn in More Alien Research]
I have forwarded to you our information concerning Yuun. For now, I must return to my art.
[Stare Blankly]
Commander! Tell that blasted protocol droid that if he ever sets foot near my food hangars again, I'll have him scrapped and use his parts for experiments!
Low calorie meals?! Pah! What... trite ignorance! Doesn't he realize food is the fuel of creativity? Meddlesome... prattling... little.... The nerve!
Where's my spanner?! I must re-center myself!
Commander, I'm unsure what's gotten into that protocol droid, but he recently came by and dropped off a crate of packed meals in the middle of the lab.
Firstly, I do not allow eating within this lab. Secondly, my staff otherwise has ready access to the base cantina for meals. The gesture is honestly more nuisance than help.
Commander, someone has installed extra padding on all of the seats in the lab, plus any other surface that could be mistaken for one. It must have been that meddlesome protocol droid.
Assuming this isn't some passive-aggressive slight against myself as a Hutt, these cushions are putting dust and feathers into the air that are interfering with our sensitive work.
Not to mention the fact that at least one of them has proven to be disturbingly flammable.... I've had them removed. Tell that droid to cease this nonsense.
Commander. Do you care to tell me what that protocol droid was doing near the lab's air circulators? I.... That divine fragrance... is that Alderaanian nectar?
Yes, aromatherapy! Of course! Inspiring the mind by inspiring the senses! I dare say that droid has actually had a brilliant idea. Ahhh, yes... I must create.
Quite fascinating, really! Apparently I've been overly concerned....
[Leave while you can]
In fact, he was just telling me of the Dashade, a fascinating species that--hey! Where are you going?
A Findsman who is also an accomplished engineer? I salivate to contemplate the contributions such an individual would make to our cause.
Indeed!
A pity that Doctor Drellik's research failed to bring us more tangible results. But such are the pitfalls of scientific exploration!
We shall not let this setback deter our forward momentum! Onward, to discovery!
